Heya,
> Ok, like I said before, I'm new to this group, so I was just curious, are
> you talking about a gladiator tournament?
Yes DPH suggested a tournament however he wanted 15 people to show interest
about it on the poll before anything more was worked out (reasonable, it
takes a lot of work to organise those sorts of things).

> If so, how are you going to work
> it?
Currently the idea is to setup a bunch of rules, set the scenarios and
starting conditions, and then having people play through them however they
want.
It's an honour based system, to help reduce cheating it was suggested that
people submit their saved games every 5 levels and the details from them
would be put up on a website - there people could challenge players if they
thought they were cheating and some tournament admins would go through the
scenarios themself and see if they came out with similar results or not.

> Do you have someone coding a way to let gladiator be played on the
> internet?
No, we are trying to build a scenario editor though :)
Adding in network support to gladiator is probably possible, but it may not
work too well - it's best if the game is designed from the ground up with
that in mind, it's not something easily 'tacked on'.

> There are too many messages for me to go back and try reading them
> all to catch up,
I use a message filter in my mail client that dumps all gladiator messages
into a separate folder, very easy to go through them then.  I believe
hotmail has something similar.

> so if someone could just sum up everything important I've
> missed that be helpful.
If I missed anything someone else will fill the gaps :)

Cya,
Deathifier
